definition: pigeon/dove/various birds of the family Columbidae

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: You're looking at a guy who could very well get stood up by a stray cat tonight.
sentences.chinese: 在你面前是一位今晚很可能被流浪貓放鴿子的男士。

sentences.english: I know you’re still mad at me for ditching you off.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你還在爲我放你鴿子在生氣。

sentences.english: Where the Chao Yang City dove egg has sell?
You can download Greybird from HERE.
sentences.chinese: 你還可以從這裏下載”灰鴿子”。

sentences.english: There is another version of the pigeonhole principle that comes in handy.
sentences.chinese: 另外一種版本的鴿子洞原理遲早也能碰到。

sentences.english: The swan soon alighted upon a lake, where he swam and dove.
sentences.chinese: 下車後不久的天鵝湖，他在那裏游泳和鴿子。

sentences.english: Millions of pigeons are bred for racing purposes.
sentences.chinese: 數以百萬計的鴿子都是職業賽鴿。

sentences.english: But this time YOU hold the pigeon down and I'll crap on its head!
sentences.chinese: 不過這回你來摁住鴿子，我在它頭上拉屎。

sentences.english: And these is something else to consider about rasing pigeons as a food.
sentences.chinese: 把鴿子作爲一種食物資源來飼養還要考慮其他的問題。

sentences.english: But the magnet-pigeons were in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 但是磁棒組鴿子卻陷入了麻煩之中。

sentences.english: If no other pigeon is available, her own reflection in a mirror will suffice.
sentences.chinese: 要是沒有別的鴿子，讓它在鏡子裏照見自己也行。

sentences.english: Where has the Jieyang dove egg sell?
The pig is obliged to dig a big pit for the pigeon.
sentences.chinese: 豬被迫爲西方經濟學論文鴿子掘一個大坑。

sentences.english: That pigeon was just as dead as a turd.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，是傑克，那隻鴿子像糞土一樣躺在那兒。

sentences.english: Her commercial clients include Lux, Clear, Ponds and Dove.
sentences.chinese: 她的商業客戶包括盧克斯，清晰，池塘和鴿子。

definition: don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to let off/to let slip by/to let sb get away with sth
not to see/not to meet/to have disappeared/to be missing
(in the) past/former/previous/to go over/to pass by
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
